thread.title: Air New Zealand cancels flight to Bali
thread.title_full: Air New Zealand cancels flight to Bali

author: John Anthony
title: Air New Zealand cancels flight to Bali
text:
Air New Zealand cancels flight to Bali JOHN ANTHONY Last updated 09:40, August 6 2015 ANTARA FOTO 
Ash from Mt Raung volcano has been affecting Bali flights since early July. 
Air New Zealand has cancelled a flight to Bali due to the dangers posed by a volcanic ash cloud. 
Air New Zealand flight NZ245 was scheduled to depart Auckland for Bali at 4.30pm on Wednesday but was delayed until 11am Thursday 6 August. 
Air New Zealand said the service had now been cancelled due to volcanic ash in the vicinity of Bali's Denpasar Airport and continued uncertainty around its ability to safely operate the service. 
Options for a special service to Denpasar early next week were being considered and an update would be available no later than 5pm on Thursday. 
READ MORE: Will my travel insurance cover me? 
Mount Raung volcano has wreaked havoc with flights since it began spewing corrosive, silica-based ash in early July, during the peak school holiday season. 
It is one of the most active volcanoes on the Indonesian island of Java, about 140 kilometres west of Bali. 
Customers with tickets issued on or before Wednesday for travel to or from Denpasar were being given the option to change to a later departure date on an Air New Zealand flight on or before August 29 without penalty. 
The value of the ticket may also be held in credit for payment towards travel within 12 months. 
Alternatively customers may change to another Air New Zealand destination without penalty. 
Customers who no longer chose to travel may apply for a refund without penalty. - Stuff
